name: GT Post Approval
author: Francesco Terenzani

sections.description:
GT Post Approval adds “Approve/Reject” buttons visible just for administrators and editors in the Menage > Posts page.
Not approved posts are visible just in the author’s archives and in the search results.

When you install this plugin any old posts will be approved and any new post will have to be approved.

This plugin is been made for the SEO contestants of GT GlobalWarming Awareness2007
and also for this reason the plugin has “static” features.

To make it more flexible I’ve developed the version 0.3. It’s a beta but it seems working fine. So in the version 0.3
the admin can go to Options > Approval to choose where display not approved posts and to define an user level to auto approve posts.
sections.installation:
1. Upload plugin-name.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Go in Menage > Posts to approve/reject posts.

If you are using the version 0.3:

  1. Go in Options > Approval to choose where display not approved posts and to define an user level to auto approve posts.
sections.faq:
I can’t see the post preview when I edit a post… Why? O_o

Maybe you are using the version 0.3 and you have set the option to don’t display not approved post in a single post page.
Take a look to Options > Approval 😉

It don’t works 🙁

Make me it know with a comment on the plugin homepage or in the plugin directory on WordPress.org and I will try to fix it.

Please, specify the plugin version and what expected feature don’t works (for example: “not approved post are visible in every
section of my blog” — a reply could be: “do you have already checked the options on Options > Approval on administration panel?”)
